alert.note: Alert for Shoshone (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 29 at 7:39AM MDT until August 29 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of North Idaho, including the following counties, Bonner, Boundary, Kootenai and Shoshone. Portions of Northeast Washington, including the following counties, Pend Oreille and Stevens. * WHEN...From 5 PM PDT this afternoon through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding in poor drainage and urban areas. Debris flows are also possible in steep terrain, especially recent burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms Tuesday afternoon and evening will have the potential to produce heavy rain. Then steady moderate to locally heavy rain Tuesday Night into Wednesday will lead to continued potential flooding in poor drainage and urban areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
